commit_message:
Add config options for cinder nfs backend

Currently the cinder nfs backend leaves out few options in a
multi backend deployment. It works in single nfs backend deployment
as devstack-plugin-nfs correctly configures all options[1].
We can clearly see the difference between what devstack-plugin-nfs
configures[1] and what devstack nfs configures[2].

Following options are missing which are added by this patch.
* nas_host
* nas_share_path
* nas_secure_file_operations
* nas_secure_file_permissions
* nfs_snapshot_support

[1] https://github.com/openstack/devstack-plugin-nfs/blob/dd12367f90fc86d42bfebe8a0ebb694dc0308810/devstack/plugin.sh#L60-L68
[2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/a52041cd3f067156e478e355f5712a60e12ce649/lib/cinder_backends/nfs#L32-L34

Change-Id: I03cad66abb3c6f2ae1d5cf943ac952a30961f783
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/72/868672/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name nas_host localhost iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name nas_share_path ${NFS_EXPORT_DIR} iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name nas_secure_file_operations \ ${NFS_SECURE_FILE_OPERATIONS} iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name nas_secure_file_permissions \ ${NFS_SECURE_FILE_PERMISSIONS} # NFS snapshot support is currently opt-in only. iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name nfs_snapshot_support True

commit_message:
Update container validation to use Fedora image version 36

Fedora 35 image was move to the archives, hence is no more available on the container URL. The podman jobs are failing due to the 404 error. Container image version needs to be updated to use the Fedora 36.

Closes-Bug: #2012903
Signed-off-by: Veronika Fisarova <vfisarov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5d6c67e309709ff363575189ebc8c53541bbe7ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs refs/changes/30/878630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument('--image', type=str, default='fedora:36', help='Container base image. Defaults to fedora:36')
deleted_lines: parser.add_argument('--image', type=str, default='fedora:35', help='Container base image. Defaults to fedora:35')

Closes-Bug: #2012246

commit_message:
[coordination] backend_url should be secret

The backend_url option can sometimes contain secrets.

For example when redis coordination backend is used and authentication
is enabled in redis, the plain redis password is put as an URL element.

[coordination]
backend_url=redis://:password@127.0.0.1:6379

Closes-Bug: #2012246
Change-Id: Ib918532d82c4633add7fad9c8441868cfd84001b
(cherry picked from commit 1eb2a7ac8677617e5c8a31695206077e05f3c183)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/47/878447/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable a standalone network for shares

The patch adds config options and template changes to enable a single
standalone network for serving shares from a NetApp appliance.

Closes-Bug: #1989216
Change-Id: I807edb61b6171cfd2260d1eba581019a130090c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-manila-netapp refs/changes/51/863151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace deprecated whitelist_externals

This option was deprecated in favor of the allowlist_externals option
and does no longer work in recent tox.

Change-Id: I1cbf545c382fdb4dda837699392e59061ccf8f75

commit_message:
Fix ignored [nova] service_name

The [nova] service_name parameter is supposed to be used to find
the nova endpoint from keystone catalog but in fact the parameter is
not used and has had no effect.
This change fixes the ignored parameter.

Change-Id: I00c3083d7dbcf4473af3386d114c4af9e07751a0
(cherry picked from commit 6d8fc69f94003d64e6b017218965e6867426a738)
(cherry picked from commit cc27672181903f0e08057efaee8b5277cd36eac9)

commit_message:
Fix ignored [nova] service_name

The [nova] service_name parameter is supposed to be used to find
the nova endpoint from keystone catalog but in fact the parameter is
not used and has had no effect.
This change fixes the ignored parameter.

Change-Id: I00c3083d7dbcf4473af3386d114c4af9e07751a0

commit_message:
Fix ignored [nova] service_name

The [nova] service_name parameter is supposed to be used to find
the nova endpoint from keystone catalog but in fact the parameter is
not used and has had no effect.
This change fixes the ignored parameter.

Change-Id: I00c3083d7dbcf4473af3386d114c4af9e07751a0
(cherry picked from commit 6d8fc69f94003d64e6b017218965e6867426a738)

commit_message:
Fix listener creation allowing pool protocol

Listener can be created using proxy and proxyv2 protocol which are pool
protocol and not listener protocol.

Story: 2010220
Task: 45968
Change-Id: I0b8cf3cc8dbe5bc2babc469e73e32b2ed9ccb98a
(cherry picked from commit 05b4d361721264dbb0ff9fec4bc9fa87779745a7)
(cherry picked from commit 6ae3d23e688af8b105102c8883a8e3a3228dce31)
(cherry picked from commit eeba2c2af55c40dd29095bf74ba343a963fd6c3e)

added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes listener creation failure when protocol used is PROXY or PROXYV2 which are pool protocol and not listener protocol.

subject: workload launch refactor to support continuous control plane test.
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/54/873254/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # - sanityfast: same than sanity but fails faster #IN_TEARDOWN=false FAST="" EXTERNAL_IP=$(os_cmd port show ${SRIOV_PORT} -f json -c fixed_ips | jq -r -c '.fixed_ips[0]["ip_address"]') INSTANCE_FIP=$(os_cmd floating ip create ${EXTERNAL_NET_NAME} -f json | jq -r -c '.floating_ip_address' ) if [ -z "${INSTANCE_FIP}" ]; then echo "Cannot get a new FIP" exit 66 echo "Assign FIP[${INSTANCE_FIP}] to server ${INSTANCE_NAME}" os_cmd server add floating ip ${INSTANCE_NAME} ${INSTANCE_FIP} VM_IP="${INSTANCE_FIP}"# Run openstack command with an error check. This will trigger the # cleanup_on_exit trap for sanity and sanityfast mode. This doesn't # work for command expansion - $(...) expression. function os_cmd { set -e openstack "$@" set +e } local timeout_seconds=${1:-180} IN_TEARDOWN=true local timeout_seconds=${1:-180} if [ -n "${INSTANCE_FIP}" ]; then echo "Remove ${INSTANCE_FIP} from ${INSTANCE_NAME}" openstack server remove floating ip ${INSTANCE_NAME} ${INSTANCE_FIP} grep ${INSTANCE_FIP} vm_ip.sh && rm vm_ip.sh echo "Delete floating ip ${INSTANCE_FIP}" openstack floating ip delete ${INSTANCE_FIP} fi elapsed_seconds=$((elapsed_seconds + 5)) if [ -n "${CINDER_VOL_ID}" ]; then echo "Remove cinder volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID}" openstack volume delete ${CINDER_VOL_ID} elapsed_seconds=0 while true; do openstack volume list -f value -c ID | grep -q ${CINDER_VOL_ID} if [[ ${?} -eq 1 ]]; then echo "The volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID} successfully removed" break fi sleep 5 elapsed_seconds=$((elapsed_seconds + 5 )) if [ $elapsed_seconds -ge $timeout_seconds ]; then echo "FAILURE: Failed to remove the volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID}" exit 1 fi done fi IN_TEARDOWN=false timeout_seconds=${1:-120} ssh_timeout_seconds=${1:-180} os_cmd keypair create --public-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub ${KEYPAIR_NAME} os_cmd flavor create --vcpus {{ workload_vcpu }} \ os_cmd router create ${TENANT_NET_NAME}_router os_cmd network create ${TENANT_NET_NAME} os_cmd subnet create \ os_cmd router add subnet ${TENANT_NET_NAME}_router ${TENANT_NET_NAME}_subnet os_cmd router set --external-gateway ${EXTERNAL_NET_NAME} ${TENANT_NET_NAME}_router os_cmd security group create ${SECGROUP_NAME} os_cmd security group rule create --proto icmp ${SECGROUP_NAME} os_cmd security group rule create --proto tcp --dst-port 22 ${SECGROUP_NAME} os_cmd security group rule create --proto tcp --dst-port 80 ${SECGROUP_NAME} os_cmd security group rule create --proto tcp --dst-port 443 ${SECGROUP_NAME} ## create sriov port os_cmd server create \ os_cmd server create \ INSTANCE_STATUS=$(os_cmd server show ${INSTANCE_NAME} -f json | jq -r '.status') elapsed_seconds=$((elapsed_seconds + 3)) CINDER_VOL_ID=$(os_cmd volume create --size 1 vol_${SUFFIX} -f json | jq -r .id) elapsed_seconds=0 if [ -n "${CINDER_VOL_ID}" ]; then while true; do VOL_STATUS=$(os_cmd volume show ${CINDER_VOL_ID} -f value -c status) if [[ ${VOL_STATUS} == "available" ]]; then echo "The volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID} successfully created and available" break fi sleep 5 elapsed_seconds=$((elapsed_seconds + 5)) if [ $elapsed_seconds -ge $timeout_seconds ]; then echo "FAILURE: Failed to create the volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID}" exit 1 fi done else echo "FAILURE: could not create the volume." exit 65 echo "Attach volume vol_${SUFFIX} to instance ${INSTANCE_NAME}" os_cmd server add volume ${INSTANCE_NAME} ${CINDER_VOL_ID} elapsed_seconds=$((elapsed_seconds + 3)) if [ $elapsed_seconds -ge $ssh_timeout_seconds ]; thencleanup_on_exit() { RC=$? echo "Tearing down with rc=$RC" set +e # We guard against failure during teardown. if ! ${IN_TEARDOWN}; then if [ -n "${FAST}" ]; then sanity_teardown $FAST else sanity_teardown fi else # We are in teardown, just abort. echo "Failed during Teardown." exit 64 fi if [ -n "${INSTANCE_NAME}" -a -e "${HOME}/${INSTANCE_NAME}" ]; then echo "Deleting ~/${INSTANCE_NAME}" rm -f "${HOME}/${INSTANCE_NAME}" fi exit $RC } trap cleanup_on_exit EXITfi if [[ "${MODE}" == "sanityfast" ]]; then FAST=10 trap cleanup_on_exit EXIT SUFFIX=$(openssl rand -hex 5) prepare_env sanity_check $FAST workload_launch $FAST $FAST

do VOL_STATUS=$(openstack volume show ${CINDER_VOL_ID} -f value -c status) if [[ ${VOL_STATUS} == "available" ]]; then echo "The volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID} successfully created and available" break fi sleep 5 elapsed_seconds=$(( ${elapsed_seconds} + 5 )) if [ $elapsed_seconds -ge $timeout_seconds ]; then echo "FAILURE: Failed to create the volume ${CINDER_VOL_ID}" exit 1 fi done echo "Attach volume vol_${SUFFIX} to instance ${INSTANCE_NAME}" openstack server add volume ${INSTANCE_NAME} ${CINDER_VOL_ID} if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo "Storage related error detected while attaching VOLUME to VM. Exiting with non-zero code" if [[ "${MODE}" == "sanity" ]]; then sanity_teardown fi exit 1 timeout_seconds=180 elapsed_seconds=$(expr $elapsed_seconds + 3) if [ $elapsed_seconds -ge $timeout_seconds ]; then if [[ "${MODE}" == "sanity" ]]; then sanity_teardown fi sanity_teardown

commit_message:
Fix unclear error messages in the API

Some API calls may have returned useless error messages such as

{"faultcode": "Client", "faultstring": " is not a valid option for ",
 "debuginfo": null}

when a DB constraint failed.

This commit improves the error message by reading the name of the
foreign key that failed from the exception.

The value of the parameters should have already been validated by WSME,
this exception is only thrown when there is an issue with the database
(corrupted DB, empty table or missing fields in a table).

Story 2009957
Task 44919

Change-Id: Idd6480bc0a7de7c42b34601172c2dae50077aa48
(cherry picked from commit 57e006eac321b210c98917019572b3576aefd97e)
(cherry picked from commit d3191eb939e4b3810878755273654ca91b35107e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/79/878379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The Octavia API returned an unhelpful message when a constraint failed while creating an object in the DB. The error now contains the name and the value of the parameter that breaks the constraints.

commit_message:
Fix unclear error messages in the API

Some API calls may have returned useless error messages such as

{"faultcode": "Client", "faultstring": " is not a valid option for ",
 "debuginfo": null}

when a DB constraint failed.

This commit improves the error message by reading the name of the
foreign key that failed from the exception.

The value of the parameters should have already been validated by WSME,
this exception is only thrown when there is an issue with the database
(corrupted DB, empty table or missing fields in a table).

Story 2009957
Task 44919

Change-Id: Idd6480bc0a7de7c42b34601172c2dae50077aa48
(cherry picked from commit 57e006eac321b210c98917019572b3576aefd97e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/78/878378/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The Octavia API returned an unhelpful message when a constraint failed while creating an object in the DB. The error now contains the name and the value of the parameter that breaks the constraints.

commit_message:
Fix update listener certs doesn't work

This change fixes listener update sni-container-refs
doesn't work by adding O_TRUNC flag to upload_certificate method

Change-Id: I59664615e1ef5e46a99c12256dbe02f89ecf4c0b
(cherry picked from commit d340a1de50b55a73f0e3a4d398ee735b0ccc128b)
(cherry picked from commit 524ce50564466dfd08f51fcfc0281d5b3850518c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/75/878375/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fix update listener certs failed. The fix ensures that an existing certificate gets overwritten properly.

commit_message:
Fix update listener certs doesn't work

This change fixes listener update sni-container-refs
doesn't work by adding O_TRUNC flag to upload_certificate method

Change-Id: I59664615e1ef5e46a99c12256dbe02f89ecf4c0b
(cherry picked from commit d340a1de50b55a73f0e3a4d398ee735b0ccc128b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/74/878374/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fix update listener certs failed. The fix ensures that an existing certificate gets overwritten properly.

subject: Fix prometheus-proxy systemd service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-23 12:48:36.000000000', 'files': ['elements/amphora-agent/install.d/amphora-agent-source-install/prometheus-proxy.service'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/3380b292f2fddcb62a7a64df93393df5c95e905d', 'message': 'Fix prometheus-proxy systemd service

This patch changes the inter-dependency between the prometheus-proxy
systemd service unit and the amphora-agent service. This will stop
systemd from shutting down the prometheus proxy should the amphora
agent be stopped.

Change-Id: I30c6c5809cc8568159feca193f38f62ca09874fd
(cherry picked from commit 7afe2fb24395665a45c66ee933e31b1b99b5c869)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix prometheus-proxy systemd service

This patch changes the inter-dependency between the prometheus-proxy
systemd service unit and the amphora-agent service. This will stop
systemd from shutting down the prometheus proxy should the amphora
agent be stopped.

Change-Id: I30c6c5809cc8568159feca193f38f62ca09874fd
(cherry picked from commit 7afe2fb24395665a45c66ee933e31b1b99b5c869)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/67/878367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Wants=amphora-agent.service

commit_message:
Add nova-operator tests to allow and skip list

Set the list of tests to be executed by nova operator as well as the
failing tests at the moment.

Change-Id: I6b2956e795cf03f03a99f5af668307b04c0411d2

commit_message:
Fix template issue with user_data_config_drive

Fix a python3 error that prevented to use the user_data_config_drive
option when building amphorae.

user_data_config_drive has been broken since we switched to python3,
a mix of str and bytes variables were provided to the jinja2 templates.
This commit ensures that the type of all the certificates provided to
jinja2 are strings.

Story: 2005553
Task: 30705

Change-Id: I53ed0425f00cfbbc964f5083b4f2942cf5bf565e
(cherry picked from commit 64d8d991f16dd818a981daa34ce418265a907b28)

commit_message:
Add functionality to configure virtual service IPs
(cherry picked from commit 4000b6ea72e9ca2350a24af87a22afdef08556af)

Closes-Bug: #1804057
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1021
Change-Id: I29f2eeca508048fdf8464193368cce5720559b9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-designate-bind refs/changes/00/877100/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sys from ipaddress import IPv4Address, IPv6Address # Modules imported from other interfaces/layers need to be mocked sys.modules[ 'relations.hacluster.interface_hacluster.common' ] = mock.MagicMock()class TestServiceIPFunctions(Helper): """Collection of tests for functions doing 'service_ip' configuration.""" def test_parse_service_ip_config(self): """Test function parsing 'service_ips' config option.""" service_ips = "10.0.0.1, 10.0.0.2, 2001:db8::2:1" with mock.patch.object(designate_bind.hookenv, 'config') as config: config.return_value = service_ips parsed_ips = designate_bind.parse_service_ip_config() expected_output = [ IPv4Address("10.0.0.1"), IPv4Address("10.0.0.2"), IPv6Address("2001:db8::2:1") ] self.assertEqual(expected_output, parsed_ips) def test_remove_service_ips(self): """Test removing already configured Service IPs.""" ip_to_remove = IPv4Address("10.0.0.1") ip_to_retain = IPv4Address("10.0.0.2") configured_resources = '["{0}{1}", "{0}{2}"]'.format( designate_bind.SERVICE_IP_PREFIX, ip_to_remove, ip_to_retain ) ha_cluster = mock.MagicMock() ha_cluster.get_local.return_value = configured_resources with mock.patch.object(designate_bind.reactive, 'endpoint_from_flag', return_value=ha_cluster): designate_bind.remove_service_ips(exclude=[ip_to_retain]) ha_cluster.delete_resource.assert_called_once_with("{}{}".format( designate_bind.SERVICE_IP_PREFIX, ip_to_remove )) ha_cluster.remove_colocation.assert_called_once_with( designate_bind.COLOCATION_NAME ) ha_cluster.bind_resources.assert_called_once_with() def test_remove_service_ips_no_hacluster(self): """Test that warning is logged if there's no hacluster.""" with mock.patch.object(designate_bind.reactive, 'endpoint_from_flag', return_value=None): designate_bind.remove_service_ips() expected_message = ('No relation with "ha-cluster" charm. Nothing to ' 'clear.') expected_level = designate_bind.hookenv.WARNING designate_bind.hookenv.log.assert_called_with(expected_message, expected_level) def test_add_service_ips(self): """Test configuring Service IP via hacluster resources.""" ha_cluster_mock = mock.MagicMock() crm_mock = mock.MagicMock() crm_patch = mock.patch.object(designate_bind, 'CRM', return_value=crm_mock) crm_patch.start() add_ips = [IPv4Address("10.0.0.1"), IPv6Address("2001:db8::2:1")] expected_primitive_calls = [] all_ip_resources = [] for ip_ in add_ips: resource = "{}{}".format(designate_bind.SERVICE_IP_PREFIX, ip_) ip_type = "IPaddr2" if isinstance(ip_, IPv4Address) else "IPv6addr" expected_primitive_calls.append(mock.call( resource, "ocf:heartbeat:{}".format(ip_type), params="ip={}".format(ip_), op='monitor interval="10s"' )) all_ip_resources.append(resource) with mock.patch.object(designate_bind.reactive, 'endpoint_from_flag', return_value=ha_cluster_mock): designate_bind.add_service_ips(add_ips) crm_mock.primitive.assert_has_calls(expected_primitive_calls) crm_mock.colocation.assert_called_once_with( designate_bind.COLOCATION_NAME, -10, *all_ip_resources ) ha_cluster_mock.manage_resources.assert_called_once_with(crm_mock) crm_patch.stop() def test_add_service_ips_no_config(self): """Test that function passes when there are no IPs to configure.""" ha_cluster_mock = mock.MagicMock() with mock.patch.object(designate_bind.reactive, 'endpoint_from_flag', return_value=ha_cluster_mock): designate_bind.add_service_ips([]) ha_cluster_mock.manage_resources.assert_not_called() # Assert that we also clear flag that signals that service_ips config # option is configured and charm is waiting for hacluster relation. designate_bind.reactive.clear_flag.assert_called_with( designate_bind.AWAITING_HACLUSTER_FLAG ) def test_add_service_ips_no_hacluster(self): """Test that function sets correct flag if it's missing hacluster.""" with mock.patch.object(designate_bind.reactive, 'endpoint_from_flag', return_value=None): designate_bind.add_service_ips([IPv4Address("10.0.0.1")]) designate_bind.reactive.set_flag.assert_called_with( designate_bind.AWAITING_HACLUSTER_FLAG ) def test_asses_status_passes(self): """Test scenario where _assess_status passes without blocking charm.""" self.patch_object(designate_bind.openstack_charm.OpenStackCharm, '_assess_status') self.patch_object(designate_bind, 'parse_service_ip_config') designate_bind.reactive.is_flag_set.return_value = False charm_ = designate_bind.DesignateBindCharm() charm_._assess_status() designate_bind.parse_service_ip_config.assert_called_once_with() designate_bind.hookenv.status_set.assert_not_called() def test_assess_status_bad_ip_config(self): """Test that unit is blocked if 'service_ips' config has bad format.""" self.patch_object(designate_bind.openstack_charm.OpenStackCharm, '_assess_status') self.patch_object(designate_bind, 'parse_service_ip_config') designate_bind.parse_service_ip_config.side_effect = ValueError charm_ = designate_bind.DesignateBindCharm() charm_._assess_status() expected_state = designate_bind.hookenv.WORKLOAD_STATES.BLOCKED expected_message = ('Config option "service_ips" does not have an ' 'expected format.') designate_bind.hookenv.status_set.assert_called_once_with( expected_state, expected_message ) def test_assess_status_blocks_on_awaiting_hacluster(self): """Test that unit is blocked if it's awaiting hacluster relation. This occurs when 'service_ips' config option is set but relation with hacluster charm is missing. """ self.patch_object(designate_bind.openstack_charm.OpenStackCharm, '_assess_status') self.patch_object(designate_bind, 'parse_service_ip_config') designate_bind.reactive.is_flag_set.return_value = True charm_ = designate_bind.DesignateBindCharm() charm_._assess_status() expected_state = designate_bind.hookenv.WORKLOAD_STATES.BLOCKED expected_message = ('Failed to configure "service_ips", hacluster ' 'relation is missing.') designate_bind.hookenv.status_set.assert_called_once_with( expected_state, expected_message )

commit_message:
[Wallaby Only] Switch mixed-os job to OVN raft

Noticed while investigating the related bug, the
job should validate default raft method.

Also enable Controller Nodes to act as gateway.

Related-Bug: #2012240
Change-Id: I16ff70102e8ec46b6dd1f7362e44f691153bbfb0

commit_message:
Additional check to replace missing seeded file

The additional check is based on cluster being bootstrapped and the last
backup being a SST.

The change includes new function for checking the last backup was SST
and unittests to verify said function as well as the main
charm_check_func where the check is used and seeded file is replaced.

Closes-Bug: #2000107
Change-Id: I8e516059da5299cc0e0ce8ef0802d3a46abb1a54
(cherry picked from commit a86390aeabca27167e26f38afb202e7daf39b185)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-percona-cluster refs/changes/78/874978/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BACKUP_INFO = "{data_dir}/xtrabackup_info"def last_backup_sst(): """ Check if the last backup was an SST The percona xtrabackup_info file (BACKUP_INFO) contains information about the last backup/sync to this node, including the type of backup, either incremental (IST) or full (SST). We return True if we can successfully determine the last backup was SST from the BACKUP_INFO file contents, otherwise we assume the last backup was an incremental and return False. @returns boolean """ result = False try: with open(BACKUP_INFO.format(data_dir=resolve_data_dir()), 'r') as f: lines = f.readlines() for line in lines: if re.match('^incremental = N($|\n)', line): result = True except FileNotFoundError: log("""Backup info file not found: %s, assuming last backup was incremental""" % BACKUP_INFO.format(data_dir=resolve_data_dir()), level=DEBUG) except Exception: log("""Unable to read backup info file: %s, assuming last backup was incremental""" % BACKUP_INFO.format(data_dir=resolve_data_dir()), level=DEBUG) return result # Ensure seeded file is replaced if told or after any SST event post # bootstrap. resolves bug #2000107 if (not seeded() and (ensure_seeded or (is_bootstrapped() and last_backup_sst()))):

commit_message:
Fix deprecated rule logic if the rule was deleted in policy directory.

The bug scenario:
- define deprecated rule in policy folder
- start a service
- enforce policies
- remove the rule in policy folder
- enforce policies

New default is applied to the rule,
but new and old defaults should be applied
(OR logic)
The patch fixes it.

Closes-Bug: 1977549
Change-Id: If11fe2da1163d6d3f16d133aeb207a055cf30de4

commit_message:
Switch Senlin to Alembic database migrations

sqlalchemy-migrate is no longer supported and we need to switch
to alembic for database migrations.

Change-Id: I2e51b4027f7af63944b5504ddcf50e9e48818259

"https://www.emc.com/collateral/white-papers/h15088-dell-emc-unity-replication-technologies.pdf"
with the link
"https://dl.dell.com/content/docu69886_dell-emc-unity-replication-technologies-a-detailed-review.pdf".

added_lines: <<<<<<< HEAD (667c6d Merge "Correct group:reset_group_snapshot_status policy" int)======= https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v2/?expanded=force-detach-volume-detail#force-detach-volume Consistent group support ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ For a group to support consistent group snapshot, the group specs in the corresponding group type should have the following entry: .. code-block:: ini {'consistent_group_snapshot_enabled': <is> True} Similarly, for a volume to be in a group that supports consistent group snapshots, the volume type extra specs would also have the following entry: .. code-block:: ini {'consistent_group_snapshot_enabled': <is> True} Refer to :doc:`/admin/blockstorage-groups` for command lines detail. Volume replications ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ To enable volume replications, follow below steps: 1. On Unisphere, configure remote system and interfaces for replications. The way could be different depending on the type of replications - sync or async. Refer to `Unity Replication White Paper <https://dl.dell.com/content/docu69886_dell-emc-unity-replication-technologies-a-detailed-review.pdf>`_ for more detail. 2. Add `replication_device` to storage backend settings in `cinder.conf`, then restart Cinder Volume service. Example of `cinder.conf` for volume replications: .. code-block:: ini [unity-primary] san_ip = xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx ... replication_device = backend_id:unity-secondary,san_ip:yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy,san_password:****,max_time_out_of_sync:60 - Only one `replication_device` can be configured for each primary backend. - Keys `backend_id`, `san_ip`, `san_password`, and `max_time_out_of_sync` are supported in `replication_device`, while `backend_id` and `san_ip` are required. - `san_password` uses the same one as primary backend's if it is omitted. - `max_time_out_of_sync` is the max time in minutes replications are out of sync. It must be equal or greater than `0`. `0` means sync replications of volumes will be created. Note that remote systems for sync replications need to be created on Unity first. `60` will be used if it is omitted. #. Create a volume type with property `replication_enabled='<is> True'`. .. code-block:: console $ openstack volume type create --property replication_enabled='<is> True' type-replication #. Any volumes with volume type of step #3 will failover to secondary backend after `failover_host` is executed. .. code-block:: console $ cinder failover-host --backend_id unity-secondary stein@unity-primary #. Later, they could be failed back. .. code-block:: console $ cinder failover-host --backend_id default stein@unity-primary .. note:: The volume can be deleted even when it is participating in a replication. The replication session will be deleted from Unity before the LUN is deleted. >>>>>>> CHANGE (75423a Update url of "Unity Replication White Paper")

subject: Add detailed option to show a missing field for hypervisor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-17 16:18:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/compute/v2/hypervisor.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_hypervisor.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/a3ef5ad31dc7b391822710bb784197328234ad31', 'message': 'Add detailed option to show a missing field for hypervisor

Currently, the 'Hypervisor Type' and 'host IP' fields of the result
are displayed as blank values regardless of the nova api version.

Depending on the nova api version, the api that is basically
called is as follows
< 2.53 : /os-hypervisors/{hypervisors_hostname_pattern}/search
> 2.53 : /os-hypervisors/detail?hypervisor_hostname_pattern=$PATTERN

Neither api returns the contents of the 'Hypervisor Type' and
'Host IP' fields of the result.

When the api version is 2.53 or higher,
adding the detailed option to the search function calls the
"/os-hypervisors/detail?hypervisor_hostname_pattern=$PATTERN" api.

In this api, values to be put in The 'Hypervisor Type' and
'Host IP' fields of the result.

story: 2009289
task: 43591
Change-Id: I1981383d0993b1b997e264123e7ff9c5fc46a507
'}]
commit_message:
Add detailed option to show a missing field for hypervisor

Currently, the 'Hypervisor Type' and 'host IP' fields of the result
are displayed as blank values regardless of the nova api version.

Depending on the nova api version, the api that is basically
called is as follows
< 2.53 : /os-hypervisors/{hypervisors_hostname_pattern}/search
> 2.53 : /os-hypervisors/detail?hypervisor_hostname_pattern=$PATTERN

Neither api returns the contents of the 'Hypervisor Type' and
'Host IP' fields of the result.

When the api version is 2.53 or higher,
adding the detailed option to the search function calls the
"/os-hypervisors/detail?hypervisor_hostname_pattern=$PATTERN" api.

In this api, values to be put in The 'Hypervisor Type' and
'Host IP' fields of the result.

story: 2009289
task: 43591
Change-Id: I1981383d0993b1b997e264123e7ff9c5fc46a507

commit_message:
Add requirements-tox-py310-check-uc job

We produce requirements for python3.10 now, check upper-constraints for
that python version, too.

Change-Id: Ifa381e099cb5c202815eb09e582e2fdb92075370
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/69/862969/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:py310-check-uc] basepython = python3.10 deps = -r{toxinidir}/upper-constraints.txt commands = check-conflicts {toxinidir}/upper-constraints.txt {toxinidir}/upper-constraints-xfails.txt

commit_message:
Fix the wrong exception used to retry detach API calls

When cinderclient receives an error response from API, it raises one
of the exceptions from the cinderclient.exceptions module instead of
the cinderclient.apiclient.exceptions module.

This change fixes the wrong exception used to detect 500 error from
cinder API, so that API calls to detach volumes are properly retried.

NOTE(melwitt): The difference from the cherry picked change is due to
one unit test failing under python 2.7 with the following error:

      [...]

      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/copy.py", line 257, in _deepcopy_dict
        y[deepcopy(key, memo)] = deepcopy(value, memo)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/copy.py", line 190, in deepcopy
        y = _reconstruct(x, rv, 1, memo)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/copy.py", line 329, in _reconstruct
        y = callable(*args)
    TypeError: __init__() takes at least 2 arguments (1 given)

The error was raised in test_detach_internal_server_error from the
unmocked nova.volume.cinder.API.get() method. Because the error was
being raised from get() and get() is unrelated to the detach() test and
should be mocked anyway, this cherry pick was modified to also mock
nova.volume.cinder.API.get() to avoid the error.

Closes-Bug: #1944043
Change-Id: I741cb6b29a67da8c60708c6251c441d778ca74d0
(cherry picked from commit f6206269b71d9bcaf65aa0313c21cc6b75a54fb3)
(cherry picked from commit 513241a7e4f3f3246c75e66a910db6c864c3981e)
(cherry picked from commit 7168314dd125fca8d1cecac035477ea0314ab828)
(cherry picked from commit ba3a6f385512c352374425972791084cb54ab7ee)
(cherry picked from commit 7c4ee8097c6a194e0968ef45482045d74a82c43f)

subject: Doc: Drivers should not read other backend confs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-14 18:08:06.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/utils/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/solidfire/test_solidfire.py', 'doc/source/contributor/new_driver_checklist.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/9cbe1117cf5ea7fa1affec64ba723b61bdfc5941', 'message': "Doc: Drivers should not read other backend confs

Currently there are at least 2 drivers (NetApp Data ONTAP and SolidFire)
that read other backend configuration sections to retrieve their
configuration options in order to run efficient migrations.

This is not a behavior we want to encourage in other drivers, because it
breaks the implicit contract that each backend is independent and should
only interact with other backends and cinder services via RPC calls or
the DB.

This behavior makes features depend on how cinder has been deployed,
which is not good. Efficient migration will work if a single
cinder-volume service is running with all the backends, but it won't
work if multiple cinder-volume services are running, in the same or

This patch adds to the driver contributor documentation explicit
guidelines on why this should not be done.  It also adds not comments to

method from cinder/volume/volume_utils.py into solidfire.py to hide it a
bit more from developers.

There is 1 case were reading from a different backend section makes
sense and would be acceptable, NetApp driver does it, and that is when a
backend section is used to store replication configuration options and
this section is not included in the enabled_backends sections.

Change-Id: Ia3c1318516096837ce61b08f6b49dd05922f3d06
"}]
commit_message:
Doc: Drivers should not read other backend confs

Currently there are at least 2 drivers (NetApp Data ONTAP and SolidFire)
that read other backend configuration sections to retrieve their
configuration options in order to run efficient migrations.

This is not a behavior we want to encourage in other drivers, because it
breaks the implicit contract that each backend is independent and should
only interact with other backends and cinder services via RPC calls or
the DB.

This behavior makes features depend on how cinder has been deployed,
which is not good. Efficient migration will work if a single
cinder-volume service is running with all the backends, but it won't
work if multiple cinder-volume services are running, in the same or
different hosts, with a single backend each, since the configuration
data for the other backend will not be there.

This patch adds to the driver contributor documentation explicit
guidelines on why this should not be done.  It also adds not comments to
the code of the util methods that currently do this, and moves one
method from cinder/volume/volume_utils.py into solidfire.py to hide it a
bit more from developers.

There is 1 case were reading from a different backend section makes
sense and would be acceptable, NetApp driver does it, and that is when a
backend section is used to store replication configuration options and
this section is not included in the enabled_backends sections.

Change-Id: Ia3c1318516096837ce61b08f6b49dd05922f3d06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/21/877421/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Configuration: * Drivers receive a ``configuration`` parameter on initialization, and the base driver class will store it in the instance attribute ``configuration`` and that's where they should get configuration options from, not directly of the ``oslo_config.cfg.CONF``. There are many drivers that use ``CONF`` directly, that is either legacy code (from when Cinder only supported a single backend) or caused by using such drivers as reference. * Drivers must **never** access other backend sections, from all the ``enabled_backends``, present in the configuration file. Doing so breaks the implicit contract that each backend is independent and should only interact with other backends and cinder services via RPC calls. Doing so makes features depend on how cinder has been deployed, working if a single cinder-volume service is running with all the backends, but not working if multiple cinder-volume services are running, in the same or different hosts, with a single backend each.

commit_message:
Improve the Fluentd configuration of the Elasticsearch output plugin

We had the problem that Fluentd built up a log buffer that it could no
longer reduce. This has caused a very high load on the systems.

This adjustment to the configuration of the output plugin for Elasticsearch
has now prevented the problem from occurring for weeks.

Change-Id: Idc583c09cf653c69f12d594775e948436db429d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/41/856241/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bulk_message_request_threshold 20M reload_connections true reload_after 1000 flush_thread_count 1 retry_max_interval = 2h retry_forever true

added_lines: Replication ----------- By default ES indices have replication factor equal to 1. It means that ES cluster will try to make one copy of every index's primary shard. Every copy (replica) must reside on a different cluster node than primary shard or other copies of the same shard. This of course is not be possible in a single-node deployments, where all of the newly created indices immediately go into a yellow health status which means warning. It's possible to modify replicas number in order to get rid of the yellow health state or to be extra safe with higher number of index copies in case of 3+ node clusters. To create an index template that changes replica count for future indices: .. code-block:: console curl -s -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" {{ es_cluster_ip }}:9200/_template/flog_template -d '{"index_patterns":["flog-*"],"settings":{"number_of_shards":1,"number_of_replicas":0}}' In order to modify all the already existing indices, run: .. code-block:: console curl -s -X PUT -H "Content-Type: application/json" “{{ es_cluster_ip }}:9200/flog-*/_settings/” -d '{"index":{"number_of_replicas":0}}' with desired value for the ``number_of_replicas``.

commit_message:
Avoid generating haproxy services configs on nodes without appropriate services

The change excludes generating haproxy services.d config files
for services which hosted on non control hostgroup
in case of the nodes have their own balancer.
We can separate traffic from one input point (control group ) to several points.
Control plane can be free from non core services like Elastic etc.

Change-Id: Iaddaad49f65ab6176e1fccbff0ad1f8875bad603

commit_message:
Adds ability to group stacktraces into single fluentd message

Adds configurations for the fluent-plugin-detect-exceptions
fluentd plugin. This allows fluentd to recognize stacktraces
in logs and group them in a single message.

Closes-Bug: #1969391
Signed-off-by: Juan Pablo Suazo <jsuazo@whitestack.com>
Change-Id: Ieba4109e61c38664566483b74b46dd4c8beb933b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/64/838564/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | [`bug 1969391 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1969391>`_] Adds matching block with the detect_exceptions plugin in order to group stacktrace logs in a single message. In order to avoid recursive matching and deadlock errors, the rewrite_tag plugin is used. Firstly it adds the 'pre_detect_except.post_rewrite.' tag to all outgoing messages. The first tag is used to match all messages in order to check if a stacktrace is present. The tag is then removed after the check. If this was not the case, and the tag remained the same, the same messages would match again and again, resulting in an error. In a similar manner, the rewrite_tag plugin matches all messages with tags that dont begin with either 'pre_detect_except.' or 'post_rewrite.'. Without the first restriction, all messages would match recuresively as the plugin would add this tag to a message and immediately match again. The second restriction makes sure that messages are not matched again by the rewrite_tag plugin once the detect_exceptions plugin removes the first half of the added tag.

commit_message:
DockerWorker class refactor

Created abstract parent class ContainerWorker that defines common
interface and contains common class methods. This was done to simplify
future extensions of the kolla_docker module.

Signed-off-by: Martin Hiner <martin.hiner@tietoevry.com>
Co-authored-by: Ivan Halomi <ivan.halomi@tietoevry.com>
Change-Id: I43e3cef0b634e14793f3b8c741120c7efab30071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/83/823783/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from abc import ABC from abc import abstractmethod import shlex class ContainerWorker(ABC): def __init__(self, module): self.module = module self.params = self.module.params self.changed = False # Use this to store arguments to pass to exit_json(). self.result = {} self._cgroupns_mode_supported = False @abstractmethod def check_image(self): pass @abstractmethod def get_container_info(self): pass @abstractmethod def compare_container(self): pass def check_container_differs(self): container_info = self.get_container_info() return ( self.compare_cap_add(container_info) or self.compare_security_opt(container_info) or self.compare_image(container_info) or self.compare_ipc_mode(container_info) or self.compare_labels(container_info) or self.compare_privileged(container_info) or self.compare_pid_mode(container_info) or self.compare_cgroupns_mode(container_info) or self.compare_tmpfs(container_info) or self.compare_volumes(container_info) or self.compare_volumes_from(container_info) or self.compare_environment(container_info) or self.compare_container_state(container_info) or self.compare_dimensions(container_info) or self.compare_command(container_info) or self.compare_healthcheck(container_info) ) def compare_ipc_mode(self, container_info): new_ipc_mode = self.params.get('ipc_mode') current_ipc_mode = container_info['HostConfig'].get('IpcMode') if not current_ipc_mode: current_ipc_mode = None # only check IPC mode if it is specified if new_ipc_mode is not None and new_ipc_mode != current_ipc_mode: return True return False def compare_cap_add(self, container_info): new_cap_add = self.params.get('cap_add', list()) try: current_cap_add = container_info['HostConfig'].get('CapAdd', None) except KeyError: current_cap_add = None if not current_cap_add: current_cap_add = list() if set(new_cap_add).symmetric_difference(set(current_cap_add)): return True def compare_security_opt(self, container_info): ipc_mode = self.params.get('ipc_mode') pid_mode = self.params.get('pid_mode') privileged = self.params.get('privileged', False) # NOTE(jeffrey4l) security opt is disabled when using host ipc mode or # host pid mode or privileged. So no need to compare security opts if ipc_mode == 'host' or pid_mode == 'host' or privileged: return False new_sec_opt = self.params.get('security_opt', list()) current_sec_opt = container_info['HostConfig'].get('SecurityOpt', list()) if not current_sec_opt: current_sec_opt = list() if set(new_sec_opt).symmetric_difference(set(current_sec_opt)): return True @abstractmethod def compare_pid_mode(self, container_info): pass def compare_cgroupns_mode(self, container_info): if not self._cgroupns_mode_supported: return False new_cgroupns_mode = self.params.get('cgroupns_mode') if new_cgroupns_mode is None: # means we don't care what it is return False current_cgroupns_mode = (container_info['HostConfig'] .get('CgroupnsMode')) or \ (container_info['HostConfig'] .get('CgroupMode')) if current_cgroupns_mode in ('', None): # means the container was created on Docker pre-20.10 # it behaves like 'host' current_cgroupns_mode = 'host' return new_cgroupns_mode != current_cgroupns_mode def compare_privileged(self, container_info): new_privileged = self.params.get('privileged') current_privileged = container_info['HostConfig']['Privileged'] if new_privileged != current_privileged: return True @abstractmethod def compare_image(self, container_info=None): pass def compare_labels(self, container_info): new_labels = self.params.get('labels') current_labels = container_info['Config'].get('Labels', dict()) image_labels = self.check_image().get('Labels', dict()) for k, v in image_labels.items(): if k in new_labels: if v != new_labels[k]: return True else: del current_labels[k] if new_labels != current_labels: return True def compare_tmpfs(self, container_info): new_tmpfs = self.generate_tmpfs() current_tmpfs = container_info['HostConfig'].get('Tmpfs') if not new_tmpfs: new_tmpfs = [] if not current_tmpfs: current_tmpfs = [] if set(current_tmpfs).symmetric_difference(set(new_tmpfs)): return True def compare_volumes_from(self, container_info): new_vols_from = self.params.get('volumes_from') current_vols_from = container_info['HostConfig'].get('VolumesFrom') if not new_vols_from: new_vols_from = list() if not current_vols_from: current_vols_from = list() if set(current_vols_from).symmetric_difference(set(new_vols_from)): return True @abstractmethod def compare_volumes(self, container_info): pass def compare_environment(self, container_info): if self.params.get('environment'): current_env = dict() for kv in container_info['Config'].get('Env', list()): k, v = kv.split('=', 1) current_env.update({k: v}) for k, v in self.params.get('environment').items(): if k not in current_env: return True if current_env[k] != v: return True def compare_container_state(self, container_info): new_state = self.params.get('state') current_state = container_info['State'].get('Status') if new_state == "started" and current_state == "running": return False if new_state != current_state: return True def compare_dimensions(self, container_info): new_dimensions = self.params.get('dimensions') # NOTE(hinermar) don't need to compare empty dict with filled # if new_dimensions == {} or new_dimensions is None: # return False # NOTE(mgoddard): The names used by Docker are inconsisent between # configuration of a container's resources and the resources in # container_info['HostConfig']. This provides a mapping between the # two. dimension_map = { 'mem_limit': 'Memory', 'mem_reservation': 'MemoryReservation', 'memswap_limit': 'MemorySwap', 'cpu_period': 'CpuPeriod', 'cpu_quota': 'CpuQuota', 'cpu_shares': 'CpuShares', 'cpuset_cpus': 'CpusetCpus', 'cpuset_mems': 'CpusetMems', 'kernel_memory': 'KernelMemory', 'blkio_weight': 'BlkioWeight', 'ulimits': 'Ulimits'} unsupported = set(new_dimensions.keys()) - \ set(dimension_map.keys()) if unsupported: self.module.exit_json( failed=True, msg=repr("Unsupported dimensions"), unsupported_dimensions=unsupported) current_dimensions = container_info['HostConfig'] for key1, key2 in dimension_map.items(): # NOTE(mgoddard): If a resource has been explicitly requested, # check for a match. Otherwise, ensure it is set to the default. if key1 in new_dimensions: if key1 == 'ulimits': if self.compare_ulimits(new_dimensions[key1], current_dimensions[key2]): return True elif new_dimensions[key1] != current_dimensions[key2]: return True elif current_dimensions[key2]: # The default values of all currently supported resources are # '' or 0 - both falsey. return True def compare_ulimits(self, new_ulimits, current_ulimits): # The new_ulimits is dict, we need make it to a list of Ulimit # instance. new_ulimits = self.build_ulimits(new_ulimits) def key(ulimit): return ulimit['Name'] if current_ulimits is None: current_ulimits = [] return sorted(new_ulimits, key=key) != sorted(current_ulimits, key=key) def compare_command(self, container_info): new_command = self.params.get('command') if new_command is not None: new_command_split = shlex.split(new_command) new_path = new_command_split[0] new_args = new_command_split[1:] if (new_path != container_info['Path'] or new_args != container_info['Args']): return True def compare_healthcheck(self, container_info): new_healthcheck = self.parse_healthcheck( self.params.get('healthcheck')) current_healthcheck = container_info['Config'].get('Healthcheck') healthcheck_map = { 'test': 'Test', 'retries': 'Retries', 'interval': 'Interval', 'start_period': 'StartPeriod', 'timeout': 'Timeout'} if new_healthcheck: new_healthcheck = new_healthcheck['healthcheck'] if current_healthcheck: new_healthcheck = dict((healthcheck_map.get(k, k), v) for (k, v) in new_healthcheck.items()) return new_healthcheck != current_healthcheck else: return True else: if current_healthcheck: return True @abstractmethod def pull_image(self): pass @abstractmethod def remove_container(self): pass def generate_tmpfs(self): tmpfs = self.params.get('tmpfs') if tmpfs: # NOTE(mgoddard): Filter out any empty strings. tmpfs = [t for t in tmpfs if t] return tmpfs def generate_volumes(self): volumes = self.params.get('volumes') or self.params.get('volume') if not volumes: return None, None vol_list = list() vol_dict = dict() for vol in volumes: if len(vol) == 0: continue if ':' not in vol: vol_list.append(vol) continue split_vol = vol.split(':') if (len(split_vol) == 2 and ('/' not in split_vol[0] or '/' in split_vol[1])): split_vol.append('rw') vol_list.append(split_vol[1]) vol_dict.update({ split_vol[0]: { 'bind': split_vol[1], 'mode': split_vol[2] } }) return vol_list, vol_dict @abstractmethod def build_ulimits(self, ulimits): pass @abstractmethod def create_container(self): pass @abstractmethod def recreate_or_restart_container(self): pass @abstractmethod def start_container(self): pass def get_container_env(self): name = self.params.get('name') info = self.get_container_info() if not info: self.module.fail_json(msg="No such container: {}".format(name)) else: envs = dict() for env in info['Config']['Env']: if '=' in env: key, value = env.split('=', 1) else: key, value = env, '' envs[key] = value self.module.exit_json(**envs) def get_container_state(self): name = self.params.get('name') info = self.get_container_info() if not info: self.module.fail_json(msg="No such container: {}".format(name)) else: self.module.exit_json(**info['State']) def parse_healthcheck(self, healthcheck): if not healthcheck: return None result = dict(healthcheck={}) # All supported healthcheck parameters supported = set(['test', 'interval', 'timeout', 'start_period', 'retries']) unsupported = set(healthcheck) - supported missing = supported - set(healthcheck) duration_options = set(['interval', 'timeout', 'start_period']) if unsupported: self.module.exit_json(failed=True, msg=repr("Unsupported healthcheck options"), unsupported_healthcheck=unsupported) if missing: self.module.exit_json(failed=True, msg=repr("Missing healthcheck option"), missing_healthcheck=missing) for key in healthcheck: value = healthcheck.get(key) if key in duration_options: try: result['healthcheck'][key] = int(value) * 1000000000 except TypeError: raise TypeError( 'Cannot parse healthcheck "{0}". ' 'Expected an integer, got "{1}".' .format(value, type(value).__name__) ) except ValueError: raise ValueError( 'Cannot parse healthcheck "{0}". ' 'Expected an integer, got "{1}".' .format(value, type(value).__name__) ) else: if key == 'test': # If the user explicitly disables the healthcheck, # return None as the healthcheck object if value in (['NONE'], 'NONE'): return None else: if isinstance(value, (tuple, list)): result['healthcheck'][key] = \ [str(e) for e in value] else: result['healthcheck'][key] = \ ['CMD-SHELL', str(value)] elif key == 'retries': try: result['healthcheck'][key] = int(value) except ValueError: raise ValueError( 'Cannot parse healthcheck number of retries.' 'Expected an integer, got "{0}".' .format(type(value)) ) return result @abstractmethod def stop_container(self): pass @abstractmethod def stop_and_remove_container(self): pass @abstractmethod def restart_container(self): pass @abstractmethod def create_volume(self): pass @abstractmethod def remove_volume(self): pass @abstractmethod def remove_image(self): pass @abstractmethod def ensure_image(self): pass

commit_message:
Deploy mariaDB Galera arbitrator

In case of failure (network breakdown, hardware failure),
the quorum can be altered and thus the mariaDB cluster may
become non-operationnal until the quorum is reached again.
This feature will help to deploy a new group of hosts that
will run the Galera arbitrator and help out to guarantee the
quorum and keep the mariaDB cluster running.
More info about Galera arbitrator here:
https://galeracluster.com/library/documentation/arbitrator.html

Change-Id: I9618d1f14de2c1498724298342d52377a408cce3
Implements: blueprint maria-arbitrator-quorum
Co-Authored-By: Patricio Tula <patricio.tula-ext@socgen.com>

added_lines: - name: Copying mariadb_arbitrator.cnf for arbitrator vars: service_name: "mariadb_arbitrator" service: "{{ mariadb_services[service_name] }}" merge_configs: sources: - "{{ role_path }}/templates/mariadb_arbitrator.cnf.j2" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ service_name }}/mariadb_arbitrator.cnf" owner: "{{ config_owner_user }}" group: "{{ config_owner_group }}" mode: "0660" register: arbitrator_config become: true when: - inventory_hostname in groups[service.group] - service.enabled | bool - name: Copying over config.json files for arbitrator vars: service_name: "mariadb_arbitrator" service: "{{ mariadb_services[service_name] }}" template: src: "{{ service_name }}.json.j2" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ service_name }}/config.json" mode: "0660" register: arbitrator_config_json become: true when: - inventory_hostname in groups[service.group] - service.enabled | bool notify: Restart arbitrator container

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-08-12 19:20:42.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/rabbitmq/tasks/precheck.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/75bfc68932d306f1f36e6fa4ba2c271e4996ccc1', 'message': "Detect outward-rabbitmq and rabbitmq group overlaps

commit_message:
Detect outward-rabbitmq and rabbitmq group overlaps

When the containers of groups['outward-rabbitmq'] and groups['rabbitmq']
are on the same physical machine, subsequent start of outward_rabbitmq of
groups['outward-rabbitmq'] will start to report an error. So add precheck
task to avoid this situation

Change-Id: I20056f511e95d217e926a59b8bc974d7cedeae73

commit_message:
Adds support of CADF notifying for other APIs next to keystone.

CADF notifying for Cinder, Glance, Gnocchi, Heat,
Ironic, Neutron, Nova, Panko and Trove.
Enabled when enable_audit_notifications is set to "yes".

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695054/
Change-Id: Ia5968d5019cb2948323fc2123592afa68e90afa9
Closes-Bug: #1837416
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/79/674579/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if api-paste shall be overwritten local_action: stat path="{{ item }}" run_once: True register: heat_api_paste with_first_found: - files: - "api-paste.ini" paths: - "{{ node_custom_config }}/heat/" skip: true - name: Set heat api-paste file set_fact: heat_api_paste_file: "{{ heat_api_paste.results.0.stat.path | basename }}" heat_api_paste_file_path: "{{ heat_api_paste.results.0.stat.path }}" when: - heat_api_paste.results - name: Copying over existing api-paste file become: true template: src: "{{ heat_api_paste_file_path }}" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/heat-api/{{ heat_api_paste_file }}" mode: "0660" register: heat_api-paste_overwriting when: - heat_api_paste_file is defined - inventory_hostname in groups['heat-api'] with_dict: "{{ heat_services['heat-api'] }}" notify: - Restart heat-api container

commit_message:
Allow customization of rabbitmq prometheus tcp port

Closes-Bug: #1810763

Change-Id: I11409cc05627d76f748d89cc2ce85f66b92e60cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/23/738123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: role_rabbitmq_prometheus_port: '{{ rabbitmq_prometheus_port }}', role_rabbitmq_prometheus_port: '{{ outward_rabbitmq_prometheus_port }}',

subject: Removing of unused nova services after upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-12-03 16:15:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/2bf8a1f755bb5b7cb096d83fd2cf937395a24f46', 'message': 'Removing of unused nova services after upgrade

In OpenStack Train there is not used nova-consoleauth
service anymore. So this patchset adds removing of it
after upgrade to Train.

Also after this upgrade nova-scheduler is duplicated
in OpenStack services output. It is caused by connecting new
nova-scheduler service to different DB. So this new service

commit_message:
Removing of unused nova services after upgrade

In OpenStack Train there is not used nova-consoleauth
service anymore. So this patchset adds removing of it
after upgrade to Train.

Also after this upgrade nova-scheduler is duplicated
in OpenStack services output. It is caused by connecting new
nova-scheduler service to different DB. So this new service
is stored on different place and nova-scheduler service
is visible in DB twice.
This change removes old entries of nova-scheduler after upgrade.

Closes-Bug: #1863107
Signed-off-by: o.horecny2 <o.horecny2@partner.samsung.com>
Change-Id: Ibe7c06995852e478305942cadceea8f28adbdc93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/47/765347/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Remove unused nova services gather_facts: false hosts: - nova-conductor - '&enable_nova_True' tasks: - import_role: role: nova tasks_from: remove_unused_services when: - enable_nova | bool - kolla_action == 'upgrade'

commit_message:
Support UnionTech OS server enterprise when run 'prechecks' step.

UnionTech is a well-known operating system manufacturer in China, which is a debian-based release.
We hope that the UnionTech OS server enterprise can pass the 'prechecks' step. Now the UnionTech
OS has passed the 'prechecks' step and can be successfully deployed.

Change-Id: I46e5dbb96bda07ccbc8319168eac16f0f8f27852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/76/795776/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use Docker healthchecks for masakari services

This change enables the use of Docker healthchecks for masakari services.
Implements: blueprint container-health-check

Change-Id: I48197bc7221f313f12380182b768903ded635ecc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/08/779508/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: healthcheck: "{{ masakari_api_healthcheck }}" healthcheck: "{{ masakari_engine_healthcheck }}" healthcheck: "{{ masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck }}"masakari_api_enable_healthchecks: "{{ enable_container_healthchecks }}" masakari_api_healthcheck_interval: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_interval }}" masakari_api_healthcheck_retries: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_retries }}" masakari_api_healthcheck_start_period: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_start_period }}" masakari_api_healthcheck_test: ["CMD-SHELL", "healthcheck_curl http://{{ api_interface_address | put_address_in_context('url') }}:{{ masakari_api_port }}"] masakari_api_healthcheck_timeout: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_timeout }}" masakari_api_healthcheck: interval: "{{ masakari_api_healthcheck_interval }}" retries: "{{ masakari_api_healthcheck_retries }}" start_period: "{{ masakari_api_healthcheck_start_period }}" test: "{% if masakari_api_enable_healthchecks | bool %}{{ masakari_api_healthcheck_test }}{% else %}NONE{% endif %}" timeout: "{{ masakari_api_healthcheck_timeout }}" masakari_engine_enable_healthchecks: "{{ enable_container_healthchecks }}" masakari_engine_healthcheck_interval: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_interval }}" masakari_engine_healthcheck_retries: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_retries }}" masakari_engine_healthcheck_start_period: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_start_period }}" masakari_engine_healthcheck_test: ["CMD-SHELL", "healthcheck_port masakari-engine {{ om_rpc_port }}"] masakari_engine_healthcheck_timeout: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_timeout }}" masakari_engine_healthcheck: interval: "{{ masakari_engine_healthcheck_interval }}" retries: "{{ masakari_engine_healthcheck_retries }}" start_period: "{{ masakari_engine_healthcheck_start_period }}" test: "{% if masakari_engine_enable_healthchecks | bool %}{{ masakari_engine_healthcheck_test }}{% else %}NONE{% endif %}" timeout: "{{ masakari_engine_healthcheck_timeout }}" # masakari_instancemonitor need communicate with masakari_api, we use healthcheck_curl http://internal_vip:api_port to check health masakari_instancemonitor_enable_healthchecks: "{{ enable_container_healthchecks }}" masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_interval: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_interval }}" masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_retries: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_retries }}" masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_start_period: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_start_period }}" masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_test: ["CMD-SHELL", "healthcheck_curl http://{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ masakari_api_port }}"] masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_timeout: "{{ default_container_healthcheck_timeout }}" masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck: interval: "{{ masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_interval }}" retries: "{{ masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_retries }}" start_period: "{{ masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_start_period }}" test: "{% if masakari_instancemonitor_enable_healthchecks | bool %}{{ masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_test }}{% else %}NONE{% endif %}" timeout: "{{ masakari_instancemonitor_healthcheck_timeout }}"

commit_message:
unify the wsgi logfile name

Currently, wsgi logfile name is somewhere different
in different components. After unifying logfile name,
fluentd log processor can benefit from it by using
wildcard regex expression as well as our sanity.

Change-Id: I7e7792d7cb264faba2de18209a4f9c70eaa15f8d
Signed-off-by: yaoning <yaoning@unitedstack.com>

Add support for GlusterFS Native Manila backend

Follows existing backends patterns to add support for the GlusterFS
Native driver.

Change-Id: I72254da64aef8ba4eec785a170885a4b98f944dc

'}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2020-09-16 12:29:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/8a91a8552192bd599a2085398c2fec285232799f', 'message': 'Add support for custom logging file defined by user

Kolla-ansible deployment currently using default logging
behaviour from openstack.

This patch is adding support for custom logging defined by
user. This is very useful for users who wants to customize
logging options (for each service separately).

As an example, you can imagine that user wants to send
logs as JSON natively via python3-fluent-logger directly to some IP.
This can be now achieved by custom logging.conf defined
in /etc/kolla/config/{service_name}/logging.conf by user.

Change-Id: I0dd0834ab5872006a1402b2ebf7fd09d8f62fddc
Closes-Bug: #1842317

commit_message:
Add support for custom logging file defined by user

Kolla-ansible deployment currently using default logging
behaviour from openstack.

This patch is adding support for custom logging defined by
user. This is very useful for users who wants to customize
logging options (for each service separately).

As an example, you can imagine that user wants to send
logs as JSON natively via python3-fluent-logger directly to some IP.
This can be now achieved by custom logging.conf defined
in /etc/kolla/config/{service_name}/logging.conf by user.

Change-Id: I0dd0834ab5872006a1402b2ebf7fd09d8f62fddc
Closes-Bug: #1842317
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/12/679812/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if custom logger_conf is present local_action: stat path="{{ item }}" run_once: True register: nova_logger_conf with_first_found: - files: - "logger.conf" paths: - "{{ node_custom_config }}/nova/" skip: true - name: Set nova logger_conf file set_fact: nova_logger_conf_file: "{{ nova_logger_conf.results.0.stat.path | basename }}" nova_logger_conf_file_path: "{{ nova_logger_conf.results.0.stat.path }}" when: - nova_logger_conf.results - name: logger_conf file merge merge_configs: sources: - "{{ role_path }}/templates/nova-logging.conf.j2" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/nova/logging.conf" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/nova-api/logging.conf" mode: "0660" become: true when: - nova_logger_conf_file is defined - inventory_hostname in groups['nova-api'] with_dict: "{{ nova_services['nova-api'] }}" notify: - "Restart nova-api container"

subject: Create stable document ids when pushing logs to elasticsearch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-22 11:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/common/templates/conf/filter/03-elasticsearch.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/templates/conf/output/01-es.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/templates/conf/output/00-local.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/tasks/config.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/267863a27226679ac650ac0ebe8ba85a13b1fb97', 'message': 'Create stable document ids when pushing logs to elasticsearch

by default fluentd will not generate document _id for every document when
pushing logs to elasticsearch, and elasticsearch will generate a new _id for
each document it receives. In a case of transient failure where elasticsearch
fails to process logs in time (resulting in timeout from fluentd side, or
timeout from proxy in-between) fluentd will retry an entire request as it has
no way of telling what has been processed.
This can lead to fluentd entering a loop where it tries to push the same data
into elasticsearch over and over, finally overloading it completely.

This commit enables filter bundled with fluentd-plugin-elasitcsearch[1] that
generates an unique _id for each and every document before uploading them
into elasticsearch, so that it can be deduplicated by the cluster.

Closes-Bug: #1896610

[1]: https://github.com/uken/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch#generate-hash-id

Change-Id: Ifd0544b0ec982e756d6d859f8f233a65208e7a0c
'}]
commit_message:
Create stable document ids when pushing logs to elasticsearch

by default fluentd will not generate document _id for every document when
pushing logs to elasticsearch, and elasticsearch will generate a new _id for
each document it receives. In a case of transient failure where elasticsearch
fails to process logs in time (resulting in timeout from fluentd side, or
timeout from proxy in-between) fluentd will retry an entire request as it has
no way of telling what has been processed.
This can lead to fluentd entering a loop where it tries to push the same data
into elasticsearch over and over, finally overloading it completely.

This commit enables filter bundled with fluentd-plugin-elasitcsearch[1] that
generates an unique _id for each and every document before uploading them
into elasticsearch, so that it can be deduplicated by the cluster.

Closes-Bug: #1896610

[1]: https://github.com/uken/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch#generate-hash-id

Change-Id: Ifd0544b0ec982e756d6d859f8f233a65208e7a0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/91/753291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - "conf/filter/03-elasticsearch.conf.j2"

commit_message:
Support for custom API paste files

Implements mechanism of deploying custom API paste files overriding
default ones.
API paste files configures API requests pipelining and provide only way
how to implement auditing in OpenStack deployments.
Custom paste files are copied from following path:
{{ node_custom_config }}/{{ project_name }}/{{ project_name }}-api-paste.ini;
in case of override for neutron-server default api-paste.ini the path may be:
/etc/kolla/config/neutron/neutron-api-paste.ini
(in case the {{ node_custom_config }} points to /etc/kolla/config ).

Change-Id: I93e333667add275f353b213043de1c713f049167
Blueprint: custom-paste

added_lines: - name: Check if custom api-paste is present local_action: stat path="{{ item }}" run_once: True register: heat_api_paste with_first_found: - files: - "api-paste.ini" paths: - "{{ node_custom_config }}/heat/" skip: true - name: Set heat api-paste file set_fact: heat_api_paste_file: "{{ heat_api_paste.results.0.stat.path | basename }}" heat_api_paste_file_path: "{{ heat_api_paste.results.0.stat.path }}" when: - heat_api_paste.results - name: Copying over existing api-paste file become: true template: src: "{{ heat_api_paste_file_path }}" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/heat-api/{{ heat_api_paste_file }}" mode: "0660" register: heat_api-paste_overwriting when: - heat_api_paste_file is defined - inventory_hostname in groups['heat-api'] with_dict: "{{ heat_services['heat-api'] }}" notify: - Restart heat-api container

commit_message:
Don't set hostname in monasca-agent-collector's config

`ansible_hostname` returns the unqualified hostname, which is then used
by the Monasca Agent (specifically the Libvirt plugin) to retrieve the
list of instances running on this hypervisor. However in deployments
where fully qualified hostnames are used as hypervisor names, this will
result in the list of instances being empty and the Agent complaining
about "ghost instances".

The Agent is capable of finding out the hostname of the host it's
running on automatically (using `hostname -f`) but the value specified
in the config file takes precedence. Hence this commit removes the
config parameter entirely.

An alternative would be to use `ansible_fqdn` instead, as the Agent can
extract the unqualified part of the "hostname" parameter and use it as
fallback if the specified FQDN doesn't match exactly.

Change-Id: Ia817e1d096fcd46af33c9c57888e22c1021c14fb
Closes-Bug: 1894076
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/47/749547/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[WIP]Use api-paste.ini from masakari rather kolla-ansible

Kolla-ansible should not maintance the api-paste.ini, and better way is
get it from cyborg projects. Also keep consistences with other roles.

Change-Id: Id624e04c955ce2b9b56f192d866888de20dff4fb

commit_message:
Configure proxy settings for bootstrap-servers

Behind proxy, there were several resources to be blocked to be
provisoned (apt / pip / dockerd...). Add new variables to configure
proxy called 'host_http_proxy', 'host_https_proxy' and
'host_no_proxy'.

User can use those variables for bootstrap-servers phase.

Change-Id: I39a63ef0627246279a5a74fe44a4bc855bbe77fc
Closes-Bug: #1829586

commit_message:
WIP: HA InfluxDB for Monasca

This uses consumer groups in Kafka to support creating multiple InfluxDB
replicas [1]. Before this commit only a single instance of InfluxDB was
supported. The Monasca API talks to all InfluxDB instances via HAProxy
so query performance should also improve on a busy system.

[1] https://kafka.apache.org/documentation/#intro_consumers

TODO: Sticky sessions
TODO: Documentation

Co-Authored-By: nik.parasyr@protonmail.com
Change-Id: I536612d297960a61d73099400038218a64f55861

deleted_lines: # FIXME(dszumski): This doesn't work with a FQDN so use the VIP directly ip_address = {{ kolla_internal_vip_address }}

commit_message:
Use api-paste.ini from cyborg rather kolla-ansible

Kolla-ansible should not maintance the api-paste.ini, and better way is
get it from cyborg projects. Also keep consistences with other roles.

Depends-On: I8a802617952f80cfb9f906398054ef6d17559589
Change-Id: I857a7a9dc4f62ca92c89de944dba53ecdb354f68

commit_message:
multipath.conf should be configureable

check if there is a multipath.conf in custom_config and use this file
directly instead of "generating" one out of the kolla templated file.

Change-Id: I0a1ab8c7e0f3085261e29a07bd52f478dce8be26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/11/726211/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if multipath.conf exists in node_custom_config local_action: stat path={{ node_custom_config }}/multipath.conf register: stat_multipath_conf - name: Copying over multipath.conf (template) - ! stat_multipath_conf.stat.exists with_dict: "{{ multipathd_services }}" notify: - Restart multipathd container - name: Copying over multipath.conf (custom_config) template: src: "{{ node_custom_config }}/multipath.conf" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}/multipath.conf" mode: "0660" become: true when: - inventory_hostname in groups[item.value.group] - item.value.enabled | bool - stat_multipath_conf.stat.exists

Fix Self-Signed Certificates failed

Change-Id: Ib53334fb8aed37cc87082798c5748798396aa178
Closes-Bug: #1875561

commit_message:
Remove Babel requirement

Babel is not needed as requirement, remove it.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: I9dfb86d090facd900134d97df3f0fa6eb92a51ae

commit_message:
WIP: Destroy per service

This change will allow modular service destroys.
Useful to remove nodes, services and testing for dev_mode.

NOTE: use keystone as the reference implementation to be copied out to
other roles.

Changes/features in this PS:

  * Add destroy.yml in each role
  * Destroy containers and volumes

Missing:
  * Optionally destroy service database
  * Avoid destroy with instances running in qemu/kvm
  * Cleanup service configs ?o/?
  * Cleanup ovs namespaces before ovs removal
  * Cleanup HAproxy ?o/?
  * Cleanup dev mode ?o/?

Co-Authored-By: Paul Bourke <paul.bourke@oracle.com>
Change-Id: I10b5f55002b645a6c3605f4a20548379d5f26a41

commit_message:
[haproxy] Support interfaces with '-' chars

Sometimes users may be trying to bind on interfaces that have a '-' in
them; Ansible will helpfully change this to a '_', so we must change it
back if we are to refer to the Linux device. This is mostly an issue
when using bridges. Ansible exposes the Linux device name as the
'device' attribute on the interface details.

This commit adds a way to retrieve this 'device' via a custom Jinja2
filter. Similar to kolla_address, this filter, named kolla_device,
returns the device name for a given Kolla network.

The kolla_address filter is updated to share some of the validation
logic with this filter and is renamed kolla_interface as a result.
Additional tests for the device filter are also added to the existing
tests for the address filter.

Change-Id: Ibe49eaf57992f0564d0e37cb7a7ffc891b2777c4

commit_message:
Support Pacemaker

Currently, Keepalived is used for controlling VIP based upon
the healthy check result of HAproxy.

This PS lets kolla-ansible to support Pacemaker as HA manager. It
simply replace Keepalived and Keepalived's current function in
kolla-ansible. User can choose to use Pacemaker or Keepalived
by setting 'enabled_pacemaker' option.

Change-Id: Ia04d47d1b2be4222aa54c0da7e2199db8b21c5b6
Implements: blueprint use-pacemaker-in-kolla

rbd_default_features=1 in /etc/ceph/ceph.conf. Additional,
we need add the Cinder's ceph config and keyring manual or
by ansible.After that, we can use this patch in kolla-ansible,
so the Zun can use the Ceph.

Change-Id: I6f9ed5ccec0032473920fc054217bda77eefefa1
Related-bug: #1797448
Closes-bug: #1848934
"}]
commit_message:
deploy Zun with Ceph support

We can manual install the ceph-common in host, and set the
rbd_default_features=1 in /etc/ceph/ceph.conf. Additional,
we need add the Cinder's ceph config and keyring manual or
by ansible.After that, we can use this patch in kolla-ansible,
so the Zun can use the Ceph.

Change-Id: I6f9ed5ccec0032473920fc054217bda77eefefa1
Related-bug: #1797448
Closes-bug: #1848934

added_lines: - include_tasks: external_ceph.yml when: - enable_ceph | bool == False - zun_backend_ceph | bool

commit_message:
Ensure hostname resolved by kolla configured /etc/hosts file

Remove the existing host entries which conflict with kolla inventory
to ensure that the hostname resolution correct.

Change-Id: Ieb2c27b835f0638140ef7bf26eb00df79fa0a0e0
Closes-Bug: #1853578
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/47/696047/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Ensure hostname resolved by kolla configured /etc/hosts file. block: - name: Remove the existing host entries lineinfile: dest: /etc/hosts regexp: ".*{{ item }}" state: absent with_items: "{{ groups['baremetal'] }}" when: item not in groups['bifrost'] or 'ansible_' + hostvars[item]['api_interface'] in hostvars[item] - name: Generate /etc/hosts for all of the nodes blockinfile: dest: /etc/hosts marker: "# {mark} ANSIBLE GENERATED HOSTS" block: | {% for host in groups['baremetal'] %} {% set api_interface = hostvars[host]['api_interface'] %} {% if host not in groups['bifrost'] or 'ansible_' + api_interface in hostvars[host] %} {% set hostnames = [hostvars[host]['ansible_nodename'], hostvars[host]['ansible_hostname']] %} {{ 'api' | kolla_address(host) }} {{ hostnames | unique | join(' ') }} {% endif %} {% endfor %}
deleted_lines: - name: Generate /etc/hosts for all of the nodes blockinfile: dest: /etc/hosts marker: "# {mark} ANSIBLE GENERATED HOSTS" block: | {% for host in groups['baremetal'] %} {% set api_interface = hostvars[host]['api_interface'] %} {% if host not in groups['bifrost'] or 'ansible_' + api_interface in hostvars[host] %} {% set hostnames = [hostvars[host]['ansible_nodename'], hostvars[host]['ansible_hostname']] %} {{ 'api' | kolla_address(host) }} {{ hostnames | unique | join(' ') }} {% endif %} {% endfor %}

commit_message:
Swift: parametrize rsyncd max connections

Max connections in rsyncd template used hardcoded values and this
commits allows to now customize them

It creates the variables:
* swift_rsyncd_max_connections_account
* swift_rsyncd_max_connections_container
* swift_rsyncd_max_connections_object

Change-Id: I095e489ed02c730c84b3490d0b77c831bee0992b
Closes-Bug: #1852095
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/28/693728/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max connections = {{ swift_rsyncd_max_connections_account }}max connections = {{ swift_rsyncd_max_connections_container }}max connections = {{ swift_rsyncd_max_connections_object }}
